equations.name: Free particle
equations.context: Classical Mechanics - Single particle with no potential

equations.name: Particle in gravitational field
equations.equation: L = (1/2) m v^2 - m g h

equations.name: Forced harmonic oscillator
equations.context: Classical Mechanics - Oscillator with external driving force

equations.name: Double pendulum
equations.equation: L = (1/2) m₁ l₁² θ̇₁² + (1/2) m₂ [l₁² θ̇₁² + l₂² θ̇₂² + 2 l₁ l₂ θ̇₁ θ̇₂ cos(θ₁ - θ₂)] - (m₁ + m₂) g l₁ (1 - cos θ₁) - m₂ g l₂ (1 - cos θ₂)

equations.name: Charged particle in EM field
equations.context: Classical Mechanics - Particle in electromagnetic potential

equations.name: Central force motion
equations.context: Classical Mechanics - Motion in a central potential

equations.name: Kepler problem
equations.context: Classical Mechanics - Gravitational or Coulomb potential

equations.name: Rigid body rotation
equations.equation: L = (1/2) I₁ ω₁² + (1/2) I₂ ω₂² + (1/2) I₃ ω₃²

equations.name: Maxwell-Dirac Lagrangian
equations.equation: L = -(1/4) F_μν F^μν + ψ̄(iγ^μ D_μ - m)ψ
equations.context: Electrodynamics - Electromagnetic field coupled to fermions

equations.name: Proca Lagrangian
equations.equation: L = -(1/4) F_μν F^μν + (1/2) m² A_μ A^μ

equations.name: φ⁴ theory
equations.context: Quantum Field Theory - Self-interacting scalar field

equations.name: Complex scalar field
equations.equation: L = ∂_μ φ* ∂^μ φ - m² φ* φ
equations.context: Quantum Field Theory - Charged scalar field

equations.name: QED Lagrangian
equations.equation: L = -(1/4) F_μν F^μν + ψ̄(iγ^μ D_μ - m)ψ

equations.name: Yang-Mills Lagrangian
equations.context: Quantum Field Theory - Non-Abelian gauge theory

equations.name: QCD Lagrangian
equations.equation: L = -(1/4) G^a_μν G^aμν + ψ̄(iγ^μ D_μ - m)ψ

equations.name: Higgs mechanism
equations.equation: L = (D_μ φ)† (D^μ φ) - μ² φ† φ - λ(φ† φ)²
equations.context: Quantum Field Theory - Spontaneous symmetry breaking

equations.name: Standard Model Lagrangian (simplified)
equations.equation: L = -(1/4) F_μν F^μν - (1/4) G^a_μν G^aμν - (1/4) W^a_μν W^aμν + ψ̄(iγ^μ D_μ - m)ψ + (D_μ φ)† (D^μ φ) - V(φ)
equations.context: Quantum Field Theory - Simplified electroweak and strong interactions

equations.name: FLRW cosmology
equations.context: Cosmology - Homogeneous universe with scalar field

equations.name: Hubbard model
equations.equation: L = -t ∑_<ij>σ (c^†_iσ c_jσ + c^†_jσ c_iσ) + U ∑_i n_i↑ n_i↓

equations.name: Polyakov action
equations.context: String Theory - Alternative bosonic string action

equations.name: Superstring action
equations.equation: L = -(T/2) ∫ d²σ [√(-h) h^αβ ∂_α X^μ ∂_β X_μ - i ψ̄^μ ρ^α ∂_α ψ_μ]
equations.context: String Theory - Fermions on string worldsheet

equations.name: Pendulum
equations.equation: L = (1/2) m (ẋ² + ẏ²) - m g y - λ(x² + y² - l²)

equations.name: Wess-Zumino-Witten model
equations.context: Conformal Field Theory - Non-linear sigma model
